org.dellroad.linode.apiv4.workers

Class Worker

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dellroad.linode.apiv4.workers.Worker

  • @ThreadSafe
public class Worker
extends Object
    One worker in a WorkerPool.

    Worker Identity

    Worker instances are permanently associated with specific Linode instances. In other words, a Worker's Linode ID never changes. Also, a worker is identified as "the N'th member of worker pool X" entirely by its Linode name (see WorkerPool.getWorkerIndex()).

    As it's possible for Linode names to change, and for new Linodes to replace old ones with the same name, it's possible for one Worker instance to replace another one in a worker pool. In this case, the original Worker instance transistions to Worker.State.INVALID, leaves the worker pool, and a new Worker instance is automatically instantiated to replace it.

      • setUnmanaged

        public boolean setUnmanaged()
        Force this worker into the Worker.State.UNMANAGED state.

        This method does nothing in the Worker.State.UNMANAGED and Worker.State.INVALID states.

        If this worker is in the Worker.State.UNKNOWN, Worker.State.CREATING, Worker.State.RUNNING, or Worker.State.DESTROYING states, it will be immediately transitioned to the Worker.State.UNMANAGED state.

        Returns:
        true if this worker's state was changed, false if already in Worker.State.UNMANAGED or Worker.State.INVALID

      • setManaged

        public boolean setManaged()
        Reactivate this Worker.State.UNMANAGED worker, transitioning it to the Worker.State.UNKNOWN state.

        This method does nothing unless this worker is in the Worker.State.UNMANAGED state. If so, it will be immediately transitioned to the Worker.State.UNKNOWN state, and eventually (within several seconds) updated based on the current status of its corresponding Linode instance.

        Returns:
        true if this worker's state was changed, false if this worker is not currently Worker.State.UNMANAGED

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • destroy

        public boolean destroy()
        Forcibly destroy this worker.

        This method does nothing in the Worker.State.DESTROYING and Worker.State.INVALID states.

        Returns:
        true if successful, false if this instance is in state Worker.State.DESTROYING or Worker.State.INVALID

      • execute

        public Process execute(List<String> command)
                throws IOException
        Execute the specified command on this worker by remote execution over SSH.

        If successful, the returned Process will be added to this worker's current process set.

        This method invokes the command as root, using SSH password authentication with this worker's root password.

        Note: This requires that the sshpass(1) utility exist on the local system. The password is passed securely via file descriptor (-d flag).

        Note: For Linodes that already exist when the worker pool is started, there is no way to known the original root password. Therefore, in such cases we require that a WorkerPool.setStandardRootPassword() is configured, and assume that it is correct.

        Parameters:
        command - the command to remotely execute on this worker
        Returns:
        resulting process
        Throws:
        IOException - if process creation fails
        IllegalStateException - if this worker is not currently in state Worker.State.RUNNING
        IllegalArgumentException - if this worker's root password is not known

      • execute

        public Process execute(String username,
                       String password,
                       List<String> sshFlags,
                       List<String> command)
                throws IOException
        Execute the specified command on this worker by remote execution over SSH.

        If successful, the returned Process will be added to this worker's current process set.

        This method invokes the command using SSH password authentication with the given username and password.

        Note: This requires that the sshpass(1) utility exist on the local system. The password is passed securely via file descriptor (-d flag).

        Parameters:
        username - SSH username
        password - SSH password
        sshFlags - additional flags to ssh(1), or null for none
        command - the command to remotely execute remotely on this worker
        Returns:
        resulting process
        Throws:
        IOException - if process creation fails
        IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter other than sshFlags is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter other than sshFlags is null

      • execute

        public Process execute(String username,
                       File privateKey,
                       List<String> sshFlags,
                       List<String> command)
                throws IOException
        Execute the specified command on this worker by remote execution over SSH.

        If successful, the returned Process will be added to this worker's current process set.

        This method invokes the command using SSH public key authentication with the given username and unencrypted secret key file.

        Parameters:
        username - SSH username
        privateKey - file containing unencrypted private key
        sshFlags - additional flags to ssh(1), or null for none
        command - the command to remotely execute on this worker
        Returns:
        resulting process
        Throws:
        IOException - if process creation fails
        IllegalStateException - if this worker is not currently in state Worker.State.RUNNING
        IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter other than sshFlags is null
